feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 4:18AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG EARLY THIS MORNING... Local law enforcement and area web cams confirm pockets of dense fog along Alligator Alley early this morning. Visibility may be a quarter mile or less at times. Motorists should use caution and allow extra time to reach their destination, and use low-beam headlights only.

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued January 11 at 3:16PM HST until January 12 at 8:00AM HST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING FOR HALEAKALA SUMMIT... .A fast-moving cold front will bring freezing rain to the Summit and upper slopes of Haleakala tonight and early Friday morning. The front will move quickly east of Maui by Friday afternoon, and the chance for rainfall will diminish as temperatures gradually warm.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 2:20AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Extended arctic cold snap expected.... A strong arctic cold front will move into the region Saturday afternoon. If temperatures do not rise above freezing Saturday it is expected to mark the first of 6 or more days to 6 days where temperatures will not rise above freezing. Lows Saturday through Tuesday night are forecast to fall into or near the single digits.
